fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60269].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open a JIRA issue
2. Resolve that issue by committing a code change to the git repository that references the JIRA issue; e.g. PROJECT-0001 fixed
3. Observe the issue has the commit associated with it

PROBLEM: if this is the wrong ticket, you cannot change it unless you force push a change to the commit comment, which is highly discouraged in a multi-develop environment.

SOLUTION: one idea is, when the commit message is scanned and a jira issue is found, create a link between the issue and the commit. Allow that link to be edited or removed. Also, allow links to be manually created. In the example above, one could edit the link:

1234567 PROJECT-0001

to be

1234567 PROJECT-0002

And a commit for which the developer forgot to refer to the lira ticket could be added:

abcdef12 PROJECT-0003
fields.summary: Cannot change commit

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60264].
  {panel}

Hello,

We would like to be able to reorganize the tickets content. For example, it is very unconvenient for our QA department users that the "Issue Links" section is at the very bottom of the page within the ticket, we would like it to be right away just after the "Details" section.

More generally, we would really like to reorganize the order of sections and define the order.

Thanks for your time and interest for our request.

Best regards
fields.summary: Reorganizing tickets content

h3. Problem Definition
As of this moment, most of the Notification Scheme options set in JIRA pertain specifically to Project/Issue changes. If an Site Administrator wants to receive notifications for any site-wide, configuration, or permission changes to an instance, there is no option to do so.

h3. Suggested Solution
Include more comprehensive options to expand the Notification Scheme capabilities.
fields.summary: Email Notifications for Administrative Changes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60244].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, with the daily maintenance in Cloud, users are prompted with a notification banner on the top right in their instance to re-index due to changes in plugins. This notification keeps appearing repeatedly on any page even when it has been dismissed by users.

h3. Suggested Solution
Either:
* Run indexing in the background after maintenance is completed; OR
* Bypass indexing for changes that are not critical for the plugins, thus, the notification shouldn't pop up at all; OR
* Allow the option for dismissing the notification for a certain period of time (E.g: 1 week)
 
h3. Workaround 
Dismissing the notification manually.
fields.summary: Daily maintenance in Cloud causing persistent notification for re-indexing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60242].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
In some cases, a customer might not be able to search and select a specific column to add to the issue navigator screen. 

h3. Environment
* JIRA 
* More than 25 custom fields, which have a common word
** One of the custom fields is just the common word
** The common word appears in the search results list more than 25 items down 
** For example the set of custom fields: {code}["a unit", "aa unit", "b unit", "bb unit", "c unit", ... , "zz unit", "unit"]{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create above set of custom fields
# Open the issue navigator and click on the 'Columns' drop down. 
# Type unit

h3. Expected Results
As the custom field *unit* is an exact match to the term being searched, it should be displayed first on the list. 

h3. Actual Results
Observe that the search results do not display unit and there is no way to narrow them further to get this result.
 !Screen Shot 2016-03-18 at 4.32.40 pm.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2016-03-18 at 4.30.50 pm.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
* Rename custom fields
fields.summary: Improve behaviour of Issue Navigator 'Add Columns' search

Hello,

As more code branches being created, it would be helpful to be able to create hierarchical versions, e.g:

Trunk -> V1.0.0.B01
Trunk -> V1.0.0.B02
UAT -> V1.0.0.B01
PROD -> V1.0.0.B01

It seems JIRA Core don't have this capability for now, and all the versions will be messed around.

Thank You
fields.summary: JIRA add support for hierarchical version

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60237].
  {panel}

h3. Original Request.
Currently, if you use the post-function that allows you to copy a parent's value from any field you specify, it will cause an error when testing in workflow. 

This happens for copying the Fix Version value from a parent to subtask. When transitioning an issue, the following error appears "Error creating issue: Unable to copy value from field 'Labels' to 'Labels'"

In order to fix this, you must move the post-function to the end of the other post-functions. 

h2. There is another scenario that this request would help.
h3. Problem Definition
When you have a Post Function *Copy Value From Other Field* in the Create Transition of your workflow and value is being copied from a Custom Field and then you remove this Custom Field and try to Create an Issue in the project, you got an error message but it doesn't inform that the error has been caused by an invalid Post Function in your Workflow.

This is the error that you get:
{quote}
We can't create this issue for you right now, it could be due to unsupported content you've entered into one or more of the issue fields. If this situation persists, contact your administrator as they'll be able to access more specific information in the log file.
{quote}
h3. Suggested Solution
The error message could inform that it's not possible to Create the issue because there is an invalid Post Function configured in the Workflow.
h3. Why this is important
It's important because the User would understand why the Issue wasn't created and could easily fix it.
fields.summary: Better Warning Message For Post-Functions That Will Fail

h3. Problem Definition

Sometimes JIRA plugin will be disabled after exceeded 60 seconds default timeout. The workaround would be increasing the plugin timeout to 300 seconds according to this KB: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+applications+System+Plugin+Timeout+While+Waiting+for+Add-ons+to+Enable

h3. Suggested Solution

Increase plugin default timeout to 300 seconds so next time user no need to re-add the option in all Atlassian products.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Summary
It's not possible to change an issue type from a custom sub-task type to the default sub-task type using the 'More' > 'Move' > 'Change issue type' wizard.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new sub-task issue type
# Create a standard issue
# From this recent created standard issue create a sub-task ('More' > 'Create sub-task') and select the custom sub-task type you created on step 1
# Open this newly created sub-task issue and try to change its issue type ('More' > 'Move' > 'Change issue type') and select the default Sub-task type and click 'Next'

h3. Expected Results
You're able to change the issue type
h3. Actual Results
An error message appears on the screen: {color:red}*The issue type selected is invalid.*{color}


h3.Workaround
If you have the Issue Type field in the View Issue and Edit Issue screens you can edit the issue type from the view issue screen.
fields.summary: Cannot change custom sub-task type to default sub-task type

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60205].
  {panel}

+Request Summary+
A JIRA instance will have a few administrator. Some of these administrator must be restricted from creating new user.

+Request Description+
Some of JIRA user required administrator privilege because they need to perform some higher level configuration like schemes configuration. Once we granted an admin right to a user these users are able to create new users which will mess up the JIRA instance if they start to create users as they like. We need a feature to customize the admin privilege for certain users to achieve a balance environment in JIRA instance.

+Suggestion+
# Customize admin privilege whereby we can restrict an admin from creating new user.
fields.summary: Restrict Certain JIRA admin from creating new User

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60204].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When previewing PDFs attached to issues on JIRA 7.1 using Internet Explorer 11, most times the file is not previewed as expected.

h3. Environment
* Running Modern.IE with VirtualBox and using Internet Explorer 11.0.9600 32 Bits
* JIRA Core 7.1.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On Internet Explorer 11, open an issue that have a PDF attached;
# Click on the attached PDF's thumbnail to preview it.

h3. Expected Results
The PDF file is previewed on the screen.

h3. Actual Results
Most times, the preview screen hangs on the loading wheel. By closing the preview and opening again a few times, the preview may eventually appear.
I have recorded a video showing this behavior and attached it to this issue.
[^PDF Preview.mov]
 
h3.Workaround
* Download the attached file to the computer to visualize it;
* Use a different browser (Chrome, Firefox, Safari).
fields.summary: PDF preview not working properly on IE11

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60203].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Cannot remove user from project roles in project administration > Users and Roles

h3. Environment
JIRA v7.1.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new user with username that starts with '0'. Example '06744'
# Add user to any project role
# Click on the trash icon to remove user from project roles in project administration > Users and Roles

h3. Expected Results
User should be removed from the Project Role

h3. Actual Results
User is not removed from the Project Role

 
h3. Notes
* This is caused by the request to delete the user automatically dropping the '0' from the username. The Har file shows that the user: 6477 is deleted from the project role, instead of the expected '06477' username. 
* Does not happen on JIRA 6.x

h3.Workaround
* Remove the user from project roles in JIRA administration > User Management instead
* Avoiding the use of numeric usernames, or using the REST API to manually remove the user from the project role: 
{noformat}
curl '<BASE-URL>/rest/api/2/project/XXXX/role/10002?user=06744' -X DELETE -u....
{noformat}
fields.summary: Unable to remove user from Project Roles in project administration when the username starts with 0

h3. Summary:
The top part of the issue navigator page like the filter name and JQL search options is out of view and there will be blank space on the bottom when clicking the Comment button after doing certain steps.

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Access this [link|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-28564?jql=project%20%3D%20CONF%20AND%20fixVersion%20in%20%285.5.8%2C%205.5%2C%205.5.1%2C%205.5.2%2C%205.5.3%2C%205.5.4%2C%205.5.6%2C%205.5.7%29%20ORDER%20BY%20votes%20DESC%2C%20priority%20DESC%2C%20key%20DESC]
# Click on "Return to Search" on the top left.
# Back to the Issue Navigator view and change to "Detail View"
# Click on "Comment"

h3. Actual result:
Note the comment box opens, while the Issue Navigator Elements or the whole top part of the page is out of the view and there's a white border section below the page: The header section of the page with the filter options and the Atlassian/JIRA header is scrolled out of view:
 !image-2016-03-15-11-24-50-127.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected result:
Header is visible, Add comment button is in view, No missing/scrolled out filter elements on top.

h3. Workaround: 
Reload the page.

h3. Notes:
* It would not actually possible to scroll up to show the top part of the page after replicating the issue unless the page is being refreshed.
* The link is actually coming from the URL that is generated after clicking on an issue in the issue navigator with "Detail View"

Assuming affected version here, since that's on the current JIRA instance at atlassian.com
fields.summary: Issue Navigator Elements are out of view when clicking the comment button

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60200].
  {panel}

IMAP is fragile.  The nature of the protocol is that a partial memento of the email is made available to Mail Handlers, and that calls to the underlying message object to obtain body content and attachments result in direct chatter back to the mailserver.  If the mailserver decides for some reason to kill the connection the client Mail Handler gets a Folder Closed Exception, which is covered in quite a few places:
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-29228

Currently, what can happen is that in this situation, the mail handler cannot process the mail, because the server closed the connection.  The JIRA API for Mail Handlers currently provides a TRUE (we processed it, so mark read or delete) / FALSE (we didn't process it, leave it unread).  Unfortunately what seems to happen is that the 'broken' nature of this message is somehow cached via the IMAP connection, and is re-presented to mail handlers again, which breaks, again.

It may be possible to 'poke' the Mail Service back into life by revalidating its mail connection, but this may have unforeseen implications for other mail handers that could be in progress, hence this issue.

Potentially mail handlers could return 'true' to indicate that JIRA should mark the message read and delete, it's possible that would stop the same message being re-presented to the mail handler repeatedly, but could result in message loss without processing, so isnt a good option.

It would be better if a Mail Handler API enabled support for a specific Exception to indicate the nature of the problem (generally ALL related to IMAP), to drive the connection refresh, or return some kind of enumeration, which allows for more expressive hinting about what JIRA should do in the event of a failure to process a message that occurs at a protocol level.
fields.summary: IMAP and handling of FolderClosedExceptions

h3. Problem Definition
If a screen has been defined as default for an action and that screen has no fields, and you attempt to trigger that action, only a loading screen will appear.

# Save screen and set it as the default for Edit Issue action
# Attempt to edit an issue that uses that configuration
# You will see the loading wheel only.
# No errors occur in logs

h3. Suggested Solution

# There should be some sort of error in the JIRA logs to help us understand the issue.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60188].
  {panel}

h3. Problem
User who can't access to the issue due to Issue Security level, can somehow add a comment to the issue via email with subject contains an issue key. This is consider as a security breach and it could cause comment spam.

h3. Steps to reproduce
1) Create a test user.
2) For Issue Security level, set to a level which the test user is not permitted to access to.
3) Assign the issue security level from step 2 to an existing issue.
4) Sign in as the test user. This test user have the browse project and create issue permission in the project.
5) Access to the issue directly using the URL, user should be unable to view the issue due to issue security.
6) Send an email to the project mail handler with the subject contains the issue key.
7) Note that the email will be added as a comment to the issue, but user is still unable to view the issue.

h3. Suggestion
There should be a validation layer when creating issue or add comment from email. It should respect the issue security setting.
fields.summary: Users can add comment via email regardless of the issue's security level

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60134].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently the Release Page only has a preset of warnings does not allow for configurable warnings or alerts. See  [Using the release page to check the progress of a version|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver070/using-the-release-page-to-check-the-progress-of-a-version-762877547.html] for reference.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow more customizable warnings to be preset by users. 
For example, allow each type of the currently-available warnings to be further configurable based on issue types.
A typical use case for this is certain tasks such as Documentation tasks do not require code reviews, so it doesn't need to be a warning for such issue types.

 
h3. Workaround 
Create a label system that mirror the warnings you would like to see in the release page. Create a process to mark issues with labels and create a dashboard based on filters that parse the issues into a logical group of said warnings.
fields.summary: Add customization to release warnings

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60121].
  {panel}

SEN-2648176
My JIRA is configured with two LDAP directories. Typically each user account only exists in one directory.  However we have one user who moved regions, and thus his account was disabled on one directory and recreated on the other:

LDAP1\JSMITH (inactive)
LDAP2\JSMITH

From the logs we can see that JIRA first attempts to authenticate against LDAP1, it finds the account but authentication fails.  JIRA does not fall through and attempt the next directory, but rather gives up entirely, advising the user that their "username and password are incorrect".

If I switch the order of the directories, the user is able to log in.  However this is not a feasible solution; LDAP1 is first for performance reasons.  Also other users may migrate in the other direction.

Since it appears to be a standard domain sysadmin practice to deactivate the old account when moving users between LDAP directories, I believe JIRA should check the Inactive state of the LDAP account and if it is inactive, it should try the next user directory.
fields.summary: Inactive LDAP account does not trigger a fall-back to the next user directory.

h3. Summary
When viewing an issue from the project view, scrolling the issue down won't maintain its header fixed.
Alternatively, when opening an issue from top panel Issues>Issue key and scrolling, the summary header will also not be fixed on this instance.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access a project from Projects menu (top bar)
# Click _Issues_ on the left (project navigation)
# Select one of the listed issues
# Scroll the issue down

or

# Click on top bar Issues>Issuekey to open an issue
# Once the issue opens, scroll down

or

# Navigate to Issue Navigator and search for issues
# Right click and open an issue in a new tab
# Scroll the issue down


h3. Expected Results
While scrolling the issue down the header of the issue, containing the summary and buttons, should stay fixed.
h3. Actual Results
The header scrolls up.

h3.Notes
See attached screenshot for element inspection
Fixed header:
 !Header Fixed.png|thumbnail! 
Not fixed:
 !Header Not Fixed.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Access the results from the Issue Navigator (i.e View the issue navigator results in 'List view') and then click on the issue key. DO NOT do a right click>open in a new window.
fields.summary: Issue header isn't fixed when scrolling

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60111].
  {panel}

When a user is trying to Select a field to  add as column in the issue navigator page > List View and they have  a lot of fields with the same name(or who share similar characters), JIRA would sort this in ascending order with the ones starting with A coming first before the closest fields that match the value searched.

This issue is most perplexing when they have lots of fields with the word searched as JIRA has a limit to how many words are shown.

*Expected Result*
JIRA should present the fields that are exact matches first before other results or allow users the option to increase the number of fields returned.

*Actual Result*
JIRA shows the fields that match the word searched in ascending order and has a limit so users  would not be able to see other fields that come later.

As a JIRA Administrator, I want to edit shared filters that are owned by other users.

Currently a shared filter can only be edited by the shared filter's owner, not even a JIRA Admin can edit one.  However, a JIRA Administrator can:

# Change the owner of the filter to themselves
# Modify and save the filter
# Change the owner back to the original

This is a tedious workaround to something JIRA Administrators should be able to do without extra steps.
fields.summary: Allow JIRA Administrators to edit shared filters owned by others

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60104].
  {panel}

h2. Current situation
At _Project > Administation > "Users and roles"_ I have to click on "Add users to a role" on the top right in order to add uses to a new role or to a role that has already been added.

h2. Problem
The user interaction of this administration functionality appears to be not intuitive.

h2. Suggestion
# The text links "Add users to a role" and "Edit defaults" should be replaced with buttons. To me, a text link indicates that I can go somewhere (change the page of a website) not triggering an functionality.
# To add a role that has not been filled with users for the project I still must use the "Add users to a role" button
# To add users to a role where users are already added I can choose the following two options:
## I can use the "Add users to a role" button
## At the very top of a role list (e.g. between ADMINISTRATORS and the list element where all users and groups are listed) there is a single line text input field where I can simply enter the name of an additional user and I can submit the user by pressing the ENTER key
fields.summary: More intuitive design for adding roles in "Users and roles"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60103].
  {panel}

h2. Current situation
Under _Project > Administration > "Users and Roles"_ one can assign users to roles which are not used by the permission scheme of the project.

h2. Problem
Sometimes, it is difficult for a project administrator to know which roles are relevant for a project or let's say used by a project's permission scheme.

h3. Suggestion
*As a project administrator, I can add users to roles that are used by the project's permission scheme only so that I don't have to look up the permission scheme to know which roles are relevant.*

It may be like this:
* Users can be added to roles that are used by the project's permission scheme only
* If a role gets removed from a permission scheme and users are still added to this role there are two options
** JIRA removes the role from the project and in order to this all assigned users are getting removed automatically
** JIRA leaves the role with all assigned users in the project and marks it as being not required or without effect (*preferred*)
fields.summary: See only roles in "Users and Roles" which are applied by permission scheme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60102].
  {panel}

Currently if you add an attachment to a task and this file has a URL in its name, Activity tab from issue view will display it as a path to the referred site.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create txt file and save it as www.atlassian.com, for example.
# Go to JIRA and create a new task.
# Add the recent created file to this Task.
# Refresh the page and then delete the attachment.
# Refresh the page once more and go to Activity Tab

h3. Current behaviour

JIRA displays the attachment as an accessible URL, that can redirects you to the referred site in case you select it.

h3. Expected Behaviour
JIRA should display the attachment name as read only (not a link).

*Affected Versions*

JIRA v7.1.0-OD-02-025
JIRA v7.2.0-OD-03-010
fields.summary: Activity tab should not display attachment's name in case it is a URL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60101].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
There is currently no way to restrict workflow triggers in a project to specific repositories.

*Example:*
Someone commits a fix with a comment such as "Implementing JIRA-12345 workaround until CORECOMPONENT-123 is fixed"
Both issues would be automatically transitioned to 'In Progress' by this comment, even though no one is actually working on CORECOMPONENT-123.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great to allow auto-issue transitions to be configured / restricted by repositories.

This is the customer facing issue for https://jdog.jira-dev.com/browse/FUSE-2786.
fields.summary: Allow workflow trigger transitions to happen only for specific repositories

h3. Problem Definition
At this moment, If the user only have JIRA Software license, and does not have JIRA Core license, they are forced to have the Agile functionality in JIRA
* This bring difficulties as if they are not ready to use Agile functionality yet
* They are planning to use Agile in near future
* Does not want existing project to have Agile functionality yet
* Previously, they can just disable JIRA Agile

h3. Suggested Solution
* To introduce option either to enable or disable Agile functionality in JIRA Software

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60081].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
A user who is a member of the Project Role (Administrators) which has been added to the *Administer Project* permission is unable to edit the Project Lead. According to the [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/managing-project-permissions-185729636.html], the *Administer Project* permission allows any user w/ the permission to edit the Project Lead:
bq. Permission to administer a project in JIRA. This includes the ability to edit project role membership, project components, project versions and some project details ('Project Name', 'URL', 'Project Lead', 'Project Description').

However, with this bug, a user with the *Administer Project* permission is unable to edit the Project Lead. No errors -appear in the UI or- in the logs.

As of JIRA 7.2.0-OD-05, receiving the following Error when trying to change the Project Lead or Default Assignee as a Project Admin:
!EditProjectLeadorAssignee.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project and grant the user Project Administration permission
# Login to the instance as the user and navigate to project settings > Users and Roles
# Click on "Edit Defaults"
# Change project lead to another user
# Click "Update"

h3. Expected Results
-The update completes and pop-up window closes.- User is able to update changes to Project Lead and you see the Project Lead correctly updated on the page. 

h3. Actual Results
-The update button does not respond. You will see a brief spinning wheel, but the "Update" button does not actually update the user.-

Receiving an error indicating "You must have global administrator rights in order to modify the project key."

Looking in the logs with {{com.atlassian.jira.security}} DEBUG, all the permissions clear:
{code}
2016-03-04 17:28:28.883949500 2016-03-04 17:28:28,881 http-nio-2990-exec-227 DEBUG rfuerst 1048x24557x1 39fl15 4.15.43.214,10.85.161.148,127.0.0.1 /secure/project/EditProjectLeadAndDefaultAssignee.jspa [c.a.jira.security.WorkflowBasedPermissionManager] BROWSE_PROJECTS permission granted by permission scheme
2016-03-04 17:28:28.883951500 2016-03-04 17:28:28,881 http-nio-2990-exec-227 DEBUG rfuerst 1048x24557x1 39fl15 4.15.43.214,10.85.161.148,127.0.0.1 /secure/project/EditProjectLeadAndDefaultAssignee.jspa [c.a.jira.security.WorkflowBasedPermissionManager] ADMINISTER_PROJECTS permission granted by permission scheme
2016-03-04 17:28:28.883991500 2016-03-04 17:28:28,881 http-nio-2990-exec-227 DEBUG rfuerst 1048x24557x1 39fl15 4.15.43.214,10.85.161.148,127.0.0.1 /secure/project/EditProjectLeadAndDefaultAssignee.jspa [c.a.jira.security.WorkflowBasedPermissionManager] BROWSE_PROJECTS permission granted by permission scheme
2016-03-04 17:28:28.883997500 2016-03-04 17:28:28,881 http-nio-2990-exec-227 DEBUG rfuerst 1048x24557x1 39fl15 4.15.43.214,10.85.161.148,127.0.0.1 /secure/project/EditProjectLeadAndDefaultAssignee.jspa [c.a.jira.security.WorkflowBasedPermissionManager] ADMINISTER_PROJECTS permission granted by permission scheme
{code}

h3.Workaround
If you add the user to the {{administrators}} group, they will be able to edit the Project Lead. Or if that is not possible, another project administrator in the {{administrators}} group can make the change.
fields.summary: Project administrator cannot edit Project Lead

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60080].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
If a user is created and added to a permission scheme, and then the user is later deleted (not deactivated), if the user still remains in the permission scheme before they are deleted, the permission scheme will show as a blank screen, the browser will throw a 500 error in the browser console, and the NPE will appear in the log file (shown below).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user in User Management.
# Navigate to Issues > Permission Schemes.
# Add the user you created to any permission in a permission scheme of your choice.
# After the permission has been granted, delete that new user in User Management.
# Navigate to Issues > Permission Schemes and select the permission scheme you used in step 3. The scheme will not load.

h3. Expected Results
The permission scheme should load and you should be able to edit the permissions.

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the JIRA log file, and the permission scheme will not load in the browser:
{noformat}
2016-03-04 15:02:33.588560500 2016-03-04 15:02:33,584 http-nio-2998-exec-555 ERROR sysadmin 902x172511x1 jvz64d 4.15.43.214,10.84.193.150,127.0.0.1 /rest/internal/2/managedpermissionscheme/10600 [c.a.p.r.c.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: null
2016-03-04 15:02:33.588563500 java.lang.NullPointerException
2016-03-04 15:02:33.588563500 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeService.updateSchemeToReturnUsername(DefaultPermissionSchemeService.java:436)
2016-03-04 15:02:33.588564500 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeService.access$2200(DefaultPermissionSchemeService.java:58)
2016-03-04 15:02:33.588611500 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeService$13.apply(DefaultPermissionSchemeService.java:331)
2016-03-04 15:02:33.588612500 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeService$13.apply(DefaultPermissionSchemeService.java:327)
2016-03-04 15:02:33.588613500 	at com.atlassian.fugue.Option$Some.fold(Option.java:421)
2016-03-04 15:02:33.588613500 	at com.atlassian.fugue.Option.flatMap(Option.java:287)
2016-03-04 15:02:33.588621500 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeService.getScheme(DefaultPermissionSchemeService.java:327)
2016-03-04 15:02:33.588622500 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeService.getPermissionScheme(DefaultPermissionSchemeService.java:105)
2016-03-04 15:02:33.588630500 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.management.ManagedPermissionSchemeHelperImpl.getManagedPermissionScheme(ManagedPermissionSchemeHelperImpl.java:92)
2016-03-04 15:02:33.588631500 	... 2 filtered
2016-03-04 15:02:33.588631500 	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497)
2016-03-04 15:02:33.588632500 	at com.atlassian.plugin.util.ContextClassLoaderSettingInvocationHandler.invoke(ContextClassLoaderSettingInvocationHandler.java:26)
2016-03-04 15:02:33.588638500 	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy550.getManagedPermissionScheme(Unknown Source)
2016-03-04 15:02:33.588639500 	... 2 filtered
{noformat}
 
h3.Workaround
The value (user or group) needs to be removed from the scheme in the database. Use the following steps:

# Find the permission scheme ID (it will either be in the URL, or in the stack trace. In this case, you can see in the log file that it is '10600'. This value will be used in this example;
# Access JIRA's database;
# Run the below query to find invalid user entries on the permission scheme;
{code:sql}
SELECT * FROM schemepermissions WHERE perm_type = 'user' AND perm_parameter NOT IN (
	SELECT lower_user_name FROM cwd_user WHERE directory_id IN (
		SELECT id FROM cwd_directory));
{code}
# Delete those entries directly through the database;
# Restart JIRA;

This will remove that user from all permission schemes they are associated with.
fields.summary: Permission Scheme 500 Error and Nullpointerexception

@@ -114,6 +114,9 @@

                         </pluginArtifact>
                     </pluginArtifacts>
+                    <instructions>
+                        <Export-Package>*</Export-Package>

                 </configuration>
             </plugin>
